docs.text: you've got to think twice before you go see a movie with a title like maximum risk .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the title is generic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's meaningless .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and i can't believe it's good business .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when you pick up the phone and dial 777-film , how in the world are you supposed to remember that the new jean-claude van damme movie , the one that looked kind of cool in the trailers and is directed by some chinese hot shot , is called , geez , maximum risk ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yuck .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie itself deserves your attention .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for sweet bloody thrills , this one beats the summer blockbuster competition hands-down .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: only mission : impossible came close to delivering as skillful a thriller , and i'll give maximum risk the edge simply because it's not as slick as the tom cruise picture , and therefore more gratifying in its execution .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: much to my surprise , van damme continues to develop as a pleasant , unpretentious action hero .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his track record isn't as solid as schwarzenegger's , but he's a hell of a lot more adventurous than arnold .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in 1993 , van damme worked with hong kong's premier hardcore action director , john woo , on a fairly lame movie called hard target .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( if you can find a bootleg copy , woo's radically different director's cut is much better than what was eventually released . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this follow-up is directed by ringo lam ( city on fire , full contact ) , whose hong kong films are distinguished action pictures that have consistently played second fiddle to woo's more operatic offerings .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the surprise here is that maximum risk is a more effective hollywood action flick than either hard target or woo's subsequent broken arrow .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: here's the rundown .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: van damme plays a french cop named alain moreau who is shaken when a policeman friend ( jean-hugues anglade ) finds a corpse that's alain's exact double .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: turns out alain was separated at birth from his twin brother , michael , who has been killed by some russian heavies ( and some strangely american looking cops ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alain does some investigating .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he finds that michael had booked a flight to new york city , and received a message from someone there named alex bohemia .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: assuming michael's identity , alain flies to new york and gets tangled up with michael's girlfriend ( natasha henstridge ) , the fbi , and the russian mob in little odessa .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's as much as you need to know .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story is adequate , but not overly involving -- and the major plot points are basically explained to you twice , just in case you go out for popcorn at the wrong moment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's a love story , too , but i didn't find it terribly convincing , partly because ex-model henstridge is too high-strung in her high-profile debut ( she had precious few lines as the alien ice queen in species ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she's great to look at , and she can certainly read a line , but what she does here can't really be described as " acting . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: of course , " acting " isn't really what she was hired for ( i lost track of whether her shirt comes off more often than van damme's ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie is exceptionally violent , bordering on gratuity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( keep that in mind when planning your date . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the stunts are spectacular , and the fact that you can spot van damme's stand-in makes his work no less impressive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's only so much you can do with a car wreck , but this movie makes crisp , effective use of pile-ups in a handful of frenzied destruction derbies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and lam has a surprising , innovative sense of exactly where the camera should go to catch any bit of action .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the main difference between lam and woo , i believe , is that while woo relies on sheer spectacle to gas up his action show pieces , lam has figured out more about using cinematic space and double-barreled points of view to make things run .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: don't get me wrong -- when chow yun-fat soars through space pumping bullets out of two pistols and chewing on a toothpick with glass and confetti littering the air around him in woo's hard-boiled , it's an amazing moment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but it's a moment that's hard to reproduce in hollywood .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( for one thing , hollywood doesn't yet have chow yun-fat ! )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while woo's hollywood movies look like the work of a talented upstart , maximum risk is a surprisingly confident picture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the very first shot of the film is an awkward overhead view of a chase through the streets of a european city , but lam's use of odd camera angles becomes more efficient later on .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film editing is a particularly savvy complement to lam's shooting style , accentuating rather than amplifying the action .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the performances could have used some fine tuning ( in particular , there's an annoying , overwritten manhattan cab driver in the early scenes who should have been toned down or jettisoned completely ) , and the movie doesn't always overcome the limitations of its genre .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story is a little mundane , although there are some effective moments involving van damme's unrequited feelings toward the brother he never knew he had .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but it's not often that hollywood cranks out a truly satisfying action picture , and it's doubly surprising that this one should come with a mere whisper of publicity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: van damme fans should treat themselves to what may well be the man's best movie , and international action buffs will no doubt savor this flavorful hong kong/hollywood hybrid .
docs.label: positive
